caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 42–46. Male of
Geodromicus lucidus
(Zhejiang): 42–abdominal tergite VIII, 43–abdominal sternite VIII, 44–aedeagus, dorsal view, 45–aedeagus, lateral view, 46–aedeagus, parameral view. Scale bar: 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks. This species ( Fig. 40 ), was previously known only from the type locality in Jiangxi , China ( Shavrin

2013, 2018 ).
Geodromicus lucidus
is related to
G. cupreostigma
(see above), which also has a metallic bluish or greenish reflection of the body ( Shavrin 2013 ). A comparison of the shapes of the aedeagi of
G. lucidus
from different localities shows insignificant variability of the shapes of the median lobe and parameres ( Figs. 44–53 ). Male abdominal tergite VIII as in Fig. 42 , and male abdominal sternite VIII are as in Fig. 43 . The distribution of the species is shown in Fig. 112 . The species is here recorded from Anhui and Guizhou for the first time.
